lexUnit.name: make-up.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: cosmetics such as lipstick or powder applied to the face

sentence.text: They put too much make-up on me , so I 've decided to do it myself .
“ He even lets me put make-up on his face . ”
Every night I take off my make-up with baby lotion then I tone it and put moisturizer on .
That night , she bathed and scented her body in the bath , then blow-dried her hair and applied make-up with great care .
Her make-up was applied , under supervision , in No. 3 dressing-room , occupied by Dotty Blundell and Grace Bird .
I 'll do my make-up first , something fairly neutral so I can choose what to wear later .
The widow 's eye make-up had transferred itself to Marilyn Thompson 's handkerchief .
Angelica 's greasepaint make-up was a pale bluish grey , her hair a mass of tomato ketchup .
The remains of her whiteface make-up came off with the clotted badges of blood .
Her eye make-up had been too generously applied and was smeared .
The face make-up was known as ` fleshing " ; it was then a natural colour , not the tan that became popular later on .
If you like the feeling of silk next to your skin , you 'll like our new Light and Natural Mousse Make-up .
She was wearing a tight black mini-dress , and her hair was a dark cloud around her beautiful face , the eyes made to look even larger by skilful dark blue make-up .
There was n't a working shower and I had to clean off my make-up with cold-cream and by splashing water from the sink over myself .

She 'd only got five minutes in which to change out of this crumpled dress and fix her make-up before interviewing yet another applicant for the job of a daily nanny to help her look after the twins .
She fell asleep , accordingly , at once , after her stage make-up was removed ; and was not at all pleased to be wakened early with the news that Mrs Gracie had called .
Her face was scoured of street make-up , prior to the application of her stage make-up .
Apply some make-up and perfume if this is their normal habit .
` I 'm coming -- I 'm coming ! " she shouted back , wishing there were a key to the door as she quickly applied some light make-up .
Then she applied more make-up , and lifted her chin , ready to carry on the act of being happy .
Most people have a dab of make-up before they go on , reluctant though some are .
She emerged in a dressing-gown and sat down to remove her make-up .
The traditional way to remove your make-up is with a make-up remover or lotion , followed by skin tonic or freshener on cotton wool .
When he had left Merrill breathed a sigh of relief , but as she sat at the dressing-table removing her make-up something inside her wept .
She used little make-up , but the little was important .
She has never used a great deal of make-up .
